thread.title: Houston wine bar one of two in Texas to make national list
thread.title_full: Houston wine bar one of two in Texas to make national list

author: Jack Witthaus
title: Houston wine bar one of two in Texas to make national list
text: 13 Celsius, at 3000 Caroline St. in Midtown, was named to Food & Wine Magazine's "The… more Courtesy VJ Arizpe, The Photo Shop A pair of Texas wine bars, including a Houston spot, were selected for a national list. 13 Celsius, at 3000 Caroline St. in Midtown, was named among 19 venues on Food & Wine Magazine's "The Best Wine Bars in the U.S." list . The only other Texas bar to make the list was Winebelly in Austin. 13 Celsius, at 3000 Caroline St. in Midtown, was named to Food & Wine Magazine's "The… more Courtesy VJ Arizpe, The Photo Shop The Houston wine bar was noted for its open-air courtyard and 40-foot antique marble bar, which the magazine wrote were "equally charming places to taste your way through a wide-ranging collection" of wines from around the world. The cheese and charcuterie options were called "thoughtful." 13 Celsius opened about a decade ago and claimed to be the first wine bar in Houston to serve vino at the optimal temperature, minus 13 degrees Celsius, according to a press release . The bar features more than 300 wines. Food & Wine recently named eight restaurants to its "An Insider's Guide to Houston" list , compiled by Ford Fry, the chef-owner of State of Grace in River Oaks. The magazine also recently named David Keck, who runs popular Montrose wine bar Camerata, as one of best in the sommeliers in the U.S. Jack Witthaus produces digital content for the Houston Business Journal's website and social media accounts. Follow him on Twitter. The Houston wine bar was… more Courtesy VJ Arizpe, The Photo Shop Bizspace Spotlight
